instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3302: What is 820-3302? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BKLT_EN: What is BKLT_EN? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKLT” before “_EN”. “BKLT” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
threads.message:
Pardon me if i post it here since i can't find an imac section, iMac <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A works but no backlight

F9700 = 12v pin 1 & 2
<RESISTOR>R9712</RESISTOR> = 12v pin 1 & 2
FB9708 = 12v pin 1 & 2

P MOSFET <TRANSISTOR>Q9702</TRANSISTOR>

Pins 1,2,3 = 12v
Pin 4 = 11.75
Pin 5 = 0v

Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q9702</TRANSISTOR> still no backlight pin 5 = 0v

<RESISTOR>R9721</RESISTOR> pin 1 = 12v while pin 2 = 11.75 <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN_DIV</SIGNAL> and connected to MOSFET Gate, since this is a P MOSFET is this pin supposed to have lower voltage so MOSFET will let power through Drain?

Changed <RESISTOR>R9721</RESISTOR> still 0v on MOSFET pin 5.

Currently i am staying away from replacing <CHIP>U9700</CHIP> since VIN pin 23 power source is from <SIGNAL>PP12V_S0_BKLT_PWR</SIGNAL> which i believe generated by <TRANSISTOR>Q9702</TRANSISTOR> Drain

Any help will be appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
threads.message:
If you (at least) supposed that low voltage is required on Gate pin, WHY did you change <TRANSISTOR>Q9702</TRANSISTOR>???
I didn't see any refference about <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> presence (or not).
Post <CHIP>U9100</CHIP> voltages.
